The RAID (starting from RAID 1) enables data to be replicated on multiple hard drives so as to improve the server's data backup in case of failure. Attention: RAID 0 does not save the data and is therefore not recommended.
Size of partition
This size is the space that can be taken up by your data.
Space used

This size varies depending on the RAID used. If a server has 2 hard disks, a RAID 1 duplicates the data of a partition on the 2 disks, thus doubling the space used. If 1 of the 2 disks fails, the data will not be lost.
